summary: This report examines how child welfare agencies responded to the COVID-19 pandemic. We surveyed administrators in all 50 states, D.C., Puerto Rico, and the U.S. Virgin Islands. Officials we interviewed in 15 agencies reported declines in child abuse reports and concerns about unreported cases, as children had less contact with mandated reporters such as teachers. title: Child Welfare: Pandemic Posed Challenges, but also Created Opportunities for Agencies to Enhance Future Operations
